columns.text: In this problem, we are required to construct the DuPont identity for Smolira Golf Corp.

Before we begin, let us first define DuPont Identity.

**DuPont Identity** is an expression that shows the Return on Equity (ROE) of a company.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{ROE}& =
 \text{Profit Margin} \times\text{Asset Turnover} \times \text{Equity multiplier}\\\\
\end{aligned}$$

First, we need to determine the profit margin ratio:

**Profit margin ratio** is a financial ratio that shows the percentage of profit the company produces from its operations.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Profit margin
}& = \dfrac{\text{Operating profit}} {\text{Net sales}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

The profit margin ratio can be computed as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Profit margin
}& = \dfrac{\text{Operating profit}} {\text{Net sales}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$62,235} {\$506,454}\\ \\
&= \boxed{0.1229}\\ \\
&= \boxed{12.29\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
As can be seen, the profit margin ratio is 12.29%.

Next is to determine the asset turnover:

**Asset turnover** is a financial ratio that shows if the company is efficient in relation to its total assets in generating revenue or sales.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Asset Turnover}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Net Sales}} {\text{Average Total Assets}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

The asset turnover can be computed as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Asset Turnover}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Net Sales}} {\text{Average Total Assets}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$506,454} {(\$552,811 + \$627,868) \div 2}\\ \\
&= \boxed{0.58}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$
\
As can be seen, the asset turnover is 0.58.

Last is to determine the equity multiplier:

**Equity multiplier** measures a portion of a company's assets that is financed by shareholders' equity.

The formula is denoted as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Equity multiplier}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Total Assets}} {\text{Total Shareholders' Equity}}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$

The equity multiplier can be computed as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Equity multiplier}& =
 \dfrac{\text{Total Assets}} {\text{Total Shareholders' Equity}}\\ \\
& = \frac{\$627,868} {\$399,452}\\ \\
&= \boxed{1.57}\\ \\
\end{aligned}$$
\
As can be seen, the equity multiplier is 1.57.

Finally, to determine return on equity or ROE:

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{ROE}& =
 \text{Profit Margin} \times\text{Asset Turnover} \times \text{Equity multiplier}\\\\
&=12.29\%\times 0.58 \times 1.57 \\\\
&=0.1229 \times 0.58 \times 1.57 \\\\
&=\boxed{0.1119}\\\\
&=\boxed{11.19\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
In conclusion, the ROE is 11.19%.
In this item, we will do the DuPont identity for Smolira Golf Corporation.

**DuPont identity** is a powerful tool in analyzing the firmâ€™s performance because it expounds the basic definition of Return on equity (ROE) which focuses only on the relationship of Net income and total equity.
\
Using this, we can dig more into related ratios and examine them in detail to determine the possible specific reasons behind the resulting ROE.

The listed given are from the preceding item.
|Given |Amount | 
|--|--:| 
| Profit margin |0.1229
|Total asset turnover |0.86|
|Equity multiplier |1.58|
|Return on equity |16.81|

DuPont identity is expressed as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{ROE}&=\text{Profit Margin x Total asset turnover x E.M.}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
where:
EM= Equity Multiplier
\
We can say that **operating efficiency**, **asset use efficiency**, and **financial leverage** has an effect on the return on equity of a company.

To solve for the ROE of Smolira using the DuPont entity, the computation will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{ROE}&=\text{Profit Margin x Total asset turnover x E.M.}\\
&=\text{0.1229 x 0.86 x 1.58}\\
&=\boxed{\textbf{0.1670 or 16.70\%}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
\
where:
EM= Equity Multiplier
\
From the previous exercise, we got 16.81% as ROE but **using the DuPont identity we got 16.70%** The slight difference is due to the rounding off but they are still the same.
